page.title: 02FARMING AROUND OSSINGTON.(1)
page.content: The land of this mainly agricultural area consists of a{heavy {loam soil,}on which many crops are grown. These are{barley, wheat, oats and{oilseed rape.}This is not an area in which root crops are regularly grown.{Sheep, dairy herds}and{beef {cattle}graze on the grassland. There are three main agricultural estates,{Ossington, Laxton}and {Thoresby,}as well as individually owned farms, which employ an active workforce. However farm implements are getting larger, therefore doing all the land_work quicker, thus reducing the need for manpower. On some of the smaller farms machines such as combine harvesters are shared to help with cost cutting.
